2.author: JigWig
2.body: Theoretically the math works out the same, but realistically what you’re saying is wrong. Theoretically if Agurin was rank 1, and the top 10 players got put in a game together, Agurin might have the #4, 6, 9, and 10 players on his team, while he has to face the #2, 3, 5, 7, and 8. So while yes theoretically Agurin has worse teammates, realistically the #3 ranked player on the server isn’t necessarily better than the #10 ranked player. It’s more likely the #3 ranked player has just played more games, but that doesn’t mean his skill level is actually higher. When you get to the top 0.001 percent of players and you’re dealing with such a small sample size with such few games being played, then your logic of Agurin having worse teammates falls apart. Even if Agurin has the current rank 10 player on his team instead of the current rank 7, the skill gap is non-existent, and realistically that #10 player could pass that #7 player just after that 1 game.

4.author: Knifferoo
4.body:
I have listed 6 items including boots. First item is mythic. Second item is **either** Shadowflame *or* Seraph's, depending on champion. Boots is a third slot. Slots four, five and six are made up of three items. Zhonya's, Rabadon's and Void Staff. That's six items, not three. These are the same every game. Building Zhonya's before Rabadon's one game and building Rabadon's before Zhonya's the next does not make them two separate builds. It's the same build. 

I also feel the need to point out, once again, that you generally don't have a choice on second item. Orianna is going to get Seraph's because her mana costs are terrible. Ahri is always going to get Shadowflame to be able to do her job. Malzahar is going to get Rylai's. You're not choosing here.

Also no, Demonic and Morello are not choices for third item. Buying one of those means not buying one of Void Staff, Zhonya's and Rabadon's. Demonic *specifically* is an option for Malzahar *specifically* but don't act like that means mage items have variety. If anything that means Malzahar has slightly more variety than all of the other mages. He's not exactly representative of the mage playstyle in League anyway.  
Buying one of those items on any other champ means that you either choose to deal no damage or you invite the enemy assassin, fighter, or even tank at this point to come and bend you over with nothing you can do about it. CC them on the way in? *laughs in tenacity*

I just checked four different mages that fulfill different-ish subroles and they all have the same items listed as fourth, fifth and sixth item options on [u.gg](https://u.gg). Syndra, Viktor, Orianna and Ahri ALL have Rabadon's, Zhonya's and Void Staff as their three final item choices. And before you get on me about how Syndra and Ahri have Banshee's and Morello, respectively, listed as a sixth item option it's worth noting that they're way less commonly built AND probably the wrong choice in many cases. Checking those four champions on Lolalytics confirms the same thing. Final three items are Zhonya's, Void Staff, Rabadon's. Shocker.

Regarding Morello vs Shadowflame you're right. It's not technically strictly worse. You get 100 extra hp you don't want on Morello instead of a useful stat. I was thinking of the version coming next patch which gives the same stats as Shadowflame, but lesser or equal amounts across the board. And like I previously mentioned, you're giving up your damage or your one hope for survival to get healing cut which literally every other teammate is better suited to pick up. Mages are not supposed to run around 1v1-ing fighters anyway, so not always being near your support is irrelevant. When healing cut matters you will be near your support.

Nearly all mages have one build. Changing the order of the final three items you build is not variety. It's still the same build. Like you said you don't even always get to make that choice. Games can end way before then.

And if we dont narrow it down to just third item, its also an option on Swain. And Anivia. And Vlad. And Cass. And keep in mind, the item is currently ***BAD***. If it wasnt bad, more people would pick it. In fact, more people did pick it before Riot randomly nerfed it. 

Lmao you just cant actually read the item page, can you? Syndra is usually rabadons, void staff, zhonyas, yes. Except Banshees can replace Zhonyas. Shadowflame also can be the third item if you go seraphs. Oriannas third item is ***SHADOWFLAME***, followed by Rabadons and Void Staff. Zhonyas isnt even in her most common build. In the case of Ahri, Rabadons is often not in her final build, as Morello Banshees and Cosmic Drive all compete with it. 4.author: UNOvven
4.body:
Always, perhaps not. Almost always however? Yeah, they do. Especially when theyve got coaches behind them. 

Well sure, if we wanna exclude Galio (we shouldnt, he is basically a melee mage), then we can make it look less variable. But lets ***ACTUALLY*** see whats going on here. First, great variety of mythics. Were only missing Liandrys from the commonly picked mythics, but the champs that pro focuses on just dont use it. So 3-4 mythics. Already good. Now, Legendaries. Zhonyas is very common. Shadowflame is too. Rabadons was only built by Syndras (and non-mages), and only 3/6 times, so hardly "overwhelmingly represented". Now we also have Banshees, Horizon, and Seraphs. And if we dont exclude Ryze, we also get Morello, which leaves us at 7 different variations of legendary items bought. However more importantly is the builds we have. How many of them are overlapping? Not a lot. Yagaos Ahri build shares only Void Staff with Harders Syndra build. And Harders Syndra build shares *nothing* with Yagaos Taliyah build. Meanwhile you would fail to find any assassin builds that dont share 3 items with each other. Now lets throw in the [LCK](https://lol.fandom.com/wiki/LCK/2023_Season/Spring_Season/Scoreboards) and we also get Morellos, and your "Oh its just Yagao" thing falls apart because their Ahri pulled the same HF build.

The main point was that on Ori, Zhonyas is not part of her standard build (which it isnt). As for your examples, Talon does have a choice there, I suppose. He just has no choice prior, since Hydra is not an option. In the case of Zed, thats a difference between Zed with Hydra and Zed without Hydra. Which is already the one choice I mentioned. Qiyana also gets a choice, but loses the Hyra choice. So congrats, you found examples of all assassins ... having one choice. Just not every time the Hydra one (and I admit, I missed Qiyana, mostly because she is so bad I dont think about her tbh).

First of all, Lolalytics is far less accurate. Second of all, no you dont. Of these, Ghostblade is not a choice, its an order thing (Prowlers into Ghostblade or Ghostblade into Prowlers. Same build, different order). Hydra isnt good, thats why its never picked. Goredrinker isnt good, thats why its never picked (item winrate is super worthless as a metric, even moreso than winrate in general), and Eclipse and Duskblade are also worthless, hence never picked. Your choice is Prowlers ... or Prowlers.

4.author: Knifferoo
4.body:
How is it possible that the same assassin items built in different orders are the same build when the same mage items built in different orders are different builds? Wasn't an order thing a few comments ago. You seemed to be of the opinion that Luden's -> Sorcs -> Shadowflame -> Rabadon's -> Zhonya's -> Void Staff would be a different build to Luden's -> Sorcs - > Shadowflame -> Zhonya's -> Void Staff -> Rabadon's. Is that still the case? If so, Prowler's into Ghostblade or Ghostblade into Prowler's would have to be two different builds too, no? Can't have it both ways.

Lmao at Galio is basically a mage. You're funny. Mages famously dash into melee range and have taunts. Galio is an AP tank or fighter at best. Mage? Not even close.

Yeah the LPL builds differ a bit. Harder built Luden's -> Shadowflame -> Void Staff -> working on Rabadon's, while Shanks built \*checks notes\* Luden's -> Shadowflame -> Void Staff -> Rabadon. Before you say "uh but look look he has Banshee's" that's a substitution you could make for Zhonyas specifically vs multiple AP threats, and that's rare. If enemy comp didn't include Gwen, Akali and Heimer that's not a Banshee's.

And what's this about different champs not sharing items? You're telling me the mana-hungry sustained damage mage wants a different mythic and first legendary than the burst oriented assassin-esque mage? By your own admission assassin builds don't fully share items. Does this imply they have variety in their builds? Compare LPL and LCK Ahri builds. Looks like they are the same. Specifically for Ahri you can replace Shadowflame/Seraph's with Horizon Focus. Every build Ahri build looks like this: Everfrost -> Horizon Focus -> Zhonyas/Void Staff. Variety btw.

You bring up LCK. W1D1 and W1D2 have no Morello's anywhere on a mage. What I do see however is nearly every single mage build looking like this: Mythic -> Shadowflame/Seraph's -> Zhonya's/Rabadon's/Void Staff in any order. Curious. Like I previously mentioned, Ahri deviates slightly with a more rigid second item. So less variety for her than the champs who have built both Shadowflame and Seraph's.

Moving on to W1D3 and W1D4. Some hints of Morello here, I'll grant you that. Two games. Azir with a completed Morello in HLE vs. Liiv G3 and Syndra with an Oblivion Orb in NS vs. KT G3. Funny how both lost. Apart from that? Mythic -> Shadowflame/Seraph's -> Rabadon's/Zhonya's/Void Staff. Hmm. 

As far as I can tell pros agree with me. When you're playing a mage you build the following every game:

Mythic -> Seraph's/Shadowflame (Horizon Focus specifically on Ahri) -> Zhonyas/Rabadon's/Void Staff. That's it. That's the build.

4.author: UNOvven
4.body:
I never said the order on mage items makes a different build. The fact that mages can choose between items make different builds. No, I said that if you replace Zhonyas with Void staff, that *is* a different build, whereas you argued that isnt.

Lissandra famously dashes in melee range and has a root. Is she not a mage? Turns out, the range is not what a mage makes. Galio is not a tank, nor a fighter. He is built too squishy for that. He however isnt an assassin either, since he doesnt burst people down. Mage is the closest to a good classification we have.

Oh so two players on the same champ had the same build, ergo no build variety? Now, how do Ucals and Scouts build fit into that? Still Syndra, but, *gasp* different builds. Liandrys on both, and Zhonyas on ucal. How about Tangyuan going Morellos? Or Xiahou going crown? Or in the LCK Showmaker going Seraphs? Thats *3* mythics on the same champ, and a total of 7 legendaries built, in just two weeks. That sure sounds like a *lot* of variety to me. I mean imagine complaining that you can only pick from 3 mythics. Assassins even *technically* only have 3, and practically have 1.

... you are aware both Syndra and Ahri are burst-mages, right? And hell, Syndras dont even share their full build between each other. And no, assassin builds almost entirely do. Hydra or no hydra and maybe the last item, thats about it. Otherwise every single AD Assassin, no matter what, is on Prowlers exactly, Ghostblade, Serylda. Meanwhile not even every Syndra is on the same 3 first items, let alone every mage. And you have an interesting definition of "exactly the same" if oyu think Ahris are exactly the same. Apparently Everfrost, HF, Banshees, and building either Raba or Shadowflame is the same as Everfrost, HF, Zhonyas and Void staff. Whats that? 2 items are different? Thats actual variety? Yeah.

Ignoring that you are once again condensing like 6 builds into one, thats hilariously not even correct. Its not just Ahri that deviates (And not slightly), you also forgot Lissandra going neither Seraphs nor Shadowflame, the Karma mid, Two Azirs going neither of your second items, the Morello Azirs, the Syndra going shadowflame and Seraphs, yeah, you missed a lot. Certainly ***VERY*** far from "Mythic -> Shadowflame/Seraph's -> Rabadon's/Zhonya's/Void Staff". Which again, is still 6 builds youre condensing into one. 

Yeah except for the many, *many* examples of pros not doing that. Or the fact that you say "mythic" to hide the fact that you can choose between 3+ mythics on several mages, a luxury assassins for example dont have. Or the fact that youre condensing multiple builds into one. But at this point its clear youre either arguing in bad faith, or just really struggling to understand what a build is. I can lead you to variety, but I cant force you to see.

8.author: sp0j
8.body:
When you say an average well read person. You mean 0.001% of native English people. Being highly invested in literature is not something most people do. You are not talking about avid readers you are talking about a very specific type of person. And personally I think using the term average well read makes absolutely no sense when describing this kind of person. It's an oxymoron. They are far from average with the level you consider well read. Most people would consider average well read as anyone that just reads a decent amount.

I'm native English speaker and I read a lot. I consider my vocab to be fairly large and I've never come across that word before. A lot of words are totally useless and can be replaced with simpler more common phrases. It's very common to learn new words constantly.

8.author: AcrobaticApricot
8.body:
Huh? Obviously you can talk about the average of a subset. I'm sure you've done it before. You can say the average challenger player gets 8 cs/m even though there are very few challenger players. Or that the average billionaire can afford a yacht. Of course I don't mean the literal average in a math sense, what I mean is more like the median or mode. I mean if you picture a well-read person in your head, or to say it pretentiously, if you imagine the Platonic form of a well-read person, they know the word anathema.

And I'm pretty sure more than 0.001% of native English speakers read literary fiction... anecdotally I work at a restaurant, which is to say it's not like a university or whatever, and the majority of my coworkers do. My parents do and some of my friends do. Again, anathema is not some word James Joyce made up, it comes up a fair amount and you don't have to be a professor of literature to have encountered it. 

Regardless, the real oxymoron is calling yourself well-read while not reading any literature. That's like saying you're a mathematician even though you never got past algebra. So no matter how avid of a reader you are, if your avidity is limited to YA books and League lore you are not gonna be considered well-read, sorry.

8.author: sp0j
8.body:

I do read. Why the hell would you think I would lie about that? Stop being a pretentious snob just because you think a word should be more commonly known than it is.

8.author: AcrobaticApricot
8.body:
No what doesn't? I don't know what you're saying here man. In my anecdotal bubble (i.e. people who've been to college) we call this an ambiguous reference.

Anyway we all live in bubbles. I dunno, maybe in yours people say someone's well-read if they finished all the Harry Potter books. To me that idea is hilarious. If your acquaintances don't read literature and have small vocabularies and mine are the opposite, why do you think your experience is more representative than mine?

8.author: sp0j
8.body:
It doesn't show up widely in literature.

Are you surrounded by literature professors and librarians or something? Because that's the only explanation for your widely out of touch views on well-read.

I also find it highly amusing that for someone so well versed in literature you sure do like to talk down to people and insult them. Maybe you should read something on how to debate cordially. Your comments are reminiscent of posts on r/iamverysmart. You might want to self reflect on that.

8.author: AcrobaticApricot
8.body:
You are right about my tone, sorry, I often get frustrated in arguments on here and act like a dick or overly hostile. Honestly my bad, I don't know why I do that other than it's the tone a lot of people use in internet arguments I guess, but it's still not very nice, so sorry. 

Anyway, the whole time I've been trying to say that anathema is an uncommon word that most people don't know, I truly do not expect people to know this word and if you do I think it's pretty impressive. I am just a normal socially upper-middle class American with a college degree and so are most of my acquaintances. And you can see [here](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/anathema) that random newspapers like "Dallas News" read by other normal Americans use this word. But no, it's not common and it's perfectly reasonable if you've read a bunch of books or whatever and never encountered it, just a little surprising to me.

It's just that to me well-read means that someone is specifically notable for how much they've read. It's a way higher bar to clear, it's not even like I'm saying the average smart person knows the word anathema, we're talking about word specialists here. It's like if someone was a history buff and they said they had never heard of the "East India Company." That would just be surprising to me, if you're into history I'd expect you to know a lot of somewhat famous historical stuff. 11.author: Proxnite
11.body:
https://reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/10en95l/_/j4s1gus/?context=1

Here’s an older comment of mine going into detail about it.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: Okay I’ve got another question why is it. Some games I get 15lp and others I get 16-17lp

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: Cause sometimes it doesn’t pair you with or against a perfect combo of people with your same mmr. That extra 1-2 points in either direction is to account for you having won or lost against a team slightly better or slightly worse than you.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: Ah okay that makes sense I just feel like I’m climbing very very slowly. Like today I’m on 5 wins and 2 losses but only gained like 64lp

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: That’s perfectly average for LP gains when playing against people of your same mmr. Wins and losses don’t get calculated in a vacuum, mmr exists to prevent quick swings in either direction up or down. Because realistically, you didn’t become a better player that’s one rank higher overnight. You weren’t gold one day and woke up a plat player the next. It takes time to develop that, just like it takes time to climb. Ranked has been out for less than 2 weeks, don’t expect to fly up the ladder in a day or 2 unless you had previously been that far up the ladder before.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: What I’m mad is that my losses are from Smurf’s. And win streak is 56%

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: Neither has any affect on how LP gains and mmr work.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: But it did? I lost 16lp vs them and against 15lp after. I got punished 😂😂 so someone in gold 4 would climb faster than me in silver 4?

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: You can ignore everything I said and stick to your copium if you’d like, makes no difference to me.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: I mean I’m not ignoring it, I’m telling you what happened 😂😂

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: And I’m telling you that the point difference exists for a reason, which wasn’t you being punished for anything.

11.author: Jack_smith204
11.body: So it climbing supposed to be slow then? I’ve climb out of bronze. I’m on silver 4 rn and gaining 15lp so that’s normal.

11.author: Proxnite
11.body: Yes. It being not as fast as you personally doesn’t mean it’s slow, climbing doesn’t happen overnight and you didn’t become a higher skilled player suddenly after winning 5 of 7 games that day. Grow takes time, just like climbing takes time. 15/-15 LP gains/losses is perfectly normal.

12.author: jiku26
12.body:
I edited the post and changed the amount of minions required for a freeze to 4 since more people agree with that. Good luck being an aggressive laner in a losing matchup tho.  
  
Of course this guide does not cover every possible situation and exception. My goal is to give people  a **simple** guide for good wave-management. Not grandmaster level, but good.  
  
I never stated that I am a master or anything like that, however I am aware that wave-management is a very complex topic. But I am also aware that most people are not interested in reading a 30 page reddit post covering all possible situations.  
  
I am not arrogant or ignorant, I simply collected data from other guides, summarized it and made this post. If you critique this post you critique the other guides online. Not saying you are wrong, just thought a post like this is an interesting idea because I personally find most guides wrong too!  
Thanks for your feedback!

What are you smoking? Azir? It was a Syndra LMAO. And Perkz flashed trying to kill him too.

Varus doesn't poke either in lane with that build, especially having Lethal Tempo instead of HoB and a Rakan by his side. You can't deny cs to an Ezreal in that situation. You clearly haven't played against an Ezreal lol

14.author: saruthesage
14.body:
Edit: don’t bother reading or responding I apologize. Just realized you were a low plat enchanter support main. I’m so sorry for your loss and wasting your time, please believe whatever you wish about the game.

FF I meant Syndra w/e. Syndra still supposed to bully Ryze early, and Syndra flash is even more important than Azir flash as she’s completely immobile. Yes they traded flashes but that’s a good trade for Ryze, especially the damage followup and zoning when wave is frozen at Ryze turret.

Varus 100% pokes in lane with any build, that’s just how the champion works LMAO. Tell me you haven’t laned against Varus without telling me you haven’t laned against Varus. His E and Q have very high base damages at early levels. There’s a reason a lot of people just go comet, even when they don’t plan on going a poke build - the champion just inherently has strong long ranged harass.

How to punish Ezreal? Pretty much the same as most ADCs, he’s LESS punishing but you can still do denials. Getting any slowpush makes it impossible for Ezreal to ever fight into (just sit behind minions), meaning you can easily get good trades, harass, and block Q’s to deny CS. Get some harass down on the slowpush and you can threaten dive or harass more under turret (again, he can’t trade back into a wave). With better push you can always threaten a freeze, which Ez can handle better than other ADCs but can never break without jungle assistance. Basically, if Ez can only farm with Q the whole lane and you’re playing up as you should, he will lose CS. But you’re missing the forest for the trees, it’s not mainly about the CS leads, but the plates and lack of wave control (either setting up dives through uncontested slowpushes or ganks through uncontested freezes) that let good Varus’ get large advantages. Getting such an early kill in an awful wavestate while burning summs makes it infinitely more difficult for Varus to hit his wincons in early game.

If you can’t tell why Perkz’ ints are ints, and why Bo’s plays are good plays then you’re just not very good lmao. All plays require mistakes and punishes. The distinction between someone inting, and someone else making a good play, is how expected the play is and the difficulty of the punish. A toplaner dying to a “unexpected” 3-15-3:30 gank from enemy jg fullclear/5-camp is inting, even if the gank is performed perfectly - a midlaner dying to a level 2 gank from a non-Kayn enemy jg that took enemy raptors and flashed from behind is just a good play from that jungler. Perkz dying to a 3-man while flashless, on the most obvious support roam timer ever (off base going mid), after enemy jg has massive tempo lead and hasn’t been spotted in a while, and with wave pushing into him close to turret (ie literally no reason to walk up whatsoever) is INTING. The setup from FNC was perfect, the execution was clean, but it was also incredibly by the books and expected! Perkz should never die there and his team shouldn’t need to cover. And almost all Perkz’ deaths were similar clear overextensions. Bo level 2 ganking bot with GRAVES, into 3-camping into another gank mid (3-camp gank mid is standard, but not after you’ve griefed your tempo by like 20 seconds on a farming jungler by ganking bot level 2), cleanly executing both, is NOT standard. Yes enemies made mistakes but are they really supposed to expect Graves, the champion known for fullclearing and invading, to forsake both those wincons entirely to gank their lane (which in most cases is not easily punishable level 1). Bo’s turret dive on the Perkz death countergank was similarly very aggressive and unexpected. FNC appears to be completely out after the gank, but Bo calls to keep going, dashing in 1v3 to smokescreen under turret  so that Kaiser can flash in under turret 1v3 to 2 full health enemies with full cooldowns, so that PHOTON can also flash in 1v3 (after Kaiser pulls back from turret) under turret to barely finish the kill. It’s an insanely aggressive call to make and once again no other jungler would go for this. Like I don’t see how you could ever look at this game and think anything other than “the whole of VIT, especially Bo in the early game, are making great unorthodox plays to get advantages, but Perkz keeps inting to pull them down.”

You ever had your team losing a drag or baron when your jungler isn’t there? 4 of you alive trying to get an objective and a lone lulu or Lux supp simply steals it from across the wall because their range makes zoning them away from it relatively impossible unless you dedicate 1-2 of your own players to do so, which is 1-2 players not dmg the objective itself. Now picture that each and every game. 

You maybe frustrated that you’re reliant on a single player having smite but the alternative is having *every* objective be a 50/50 each time regardless of who’s alive on either team.

26.author: Proxnite
26.body:
That doesn’t solve anything, that just makes aggro invading junglers stronger. Especially in soloq where laners are more than reluctant to give up farm to go help their jungler defend their own camps, invading junglers will just harass and steal the enemy junglers camp because as long as they’re up a level, their smite will always be better. 

Even this new system is a downgrade of the previous one that just required 5 smite uses to upgrade. The previous system let you still be a viable smite threat even if you’re down in camps and levels, this new one is dependent on how many camps you’ve killed, so the team who is ahead can easily deny camps and keep the enemy jungler at a lower smite for longer (which was the whole issue with the level based smite dmg system, this new one is just a less extreme version of it).

26.author: EfficientPurpleCat
26.body: aggro invading junglers are still strong in this system... having the same smite doesn't change the fact if the enemy has a weak early game champ like amumu then you can just push them out of their own jungle and take all of their camps. sure it's worth less but if you can take over their jungle, keep them behind and squeeze a gank in every now and then you're going to win. i'd argue you don't even have to clear your own jungle you can just leave it for your team to pick up to and from lane since you don't have to worry about laners coming to help their jungle. if anything falling behind now makes you more useless because smite is tied to clearing camps. we've all had games where our jungle still has their jungle item at 25 mins... either way one style of juggling is going to be stronger than another and to be honest the feast or famine should be the very essence of the role.

44.author: Edraitheru14
44.body:
ARAM does not make you worse at SR. ARAM isn't the most efficient way to get better at SR, obviously SR is. But ARAM is a fun way to practice league skills. 

The most efficient way would be to crack open practice tool and run a bunch of customs with friends. But that's both boring and not practical. Especially for an Iron IV player. He's not going pro. Literally any exposure to the game will help him.

And ARAM, is a great way to get a lot of exposure much more quickly than SR. If we're talking basics.

it does lol. often times you're playing against people who have the mechanics of a 10 year old child and ever since the new aram changes, it's apparent that the gap widens between people who actually play the game and just aram (barring obvious comp differences). yes aram is fun i agree but its not the best way to improve. even your practice tool suggestion isn't a good idea because a) his friends could still be bad at the game so that doesn't do much for improvement b) playing against the same people with their playstyles doesnt help you against all the other players who play differently.

the only thing aram can realistically help you with is teamfighting but even then it's not ideal because aram has much faster spikes so you're playing with more power than you would have in a normal game. op clearly wants to get better at the game and sr is the best way to do that.

44.author: Edraitheru14
44.body:
Again, this just isn't accurate. 

Your average 30 minute SR is going to be you playing one champion, vs one other champion for 15+ minutes(especially in low Elo), 5-10 minutes of time waste wandering, and 5-10 minutes of fighting between 1-4 other champions. 

Meanwhile, in that same 30 minutes, you could have played 2 ARAMs, for a total of 30 continuous minutes of champion interactions between 20 different champions. 

No bronze 4 player has any idea what every champion does, or what the champions are capable of. ARAM allows you to develop that very basic piece of knowledge in a compact and dense fashion. 

It's also 30 straight minutes of practice piloting your character. Which again, no bronze 4 player is doing even remotely well. 

And it's entertaining and action packed, meaning they're 10x more likely to stay engaged with the content than with SR, which can easily lead to autopilot issues, and not absorbing anything. You see this a LOT with low Elo people. They're bored of laning so they just fight fight fight.

(which i dont mind, cause i dont care about rank anymore) idk what level you play at that you think aram is remotely helpful to getting better, but you can believe w.e you want to believe.

44.author: Edraitheru14
44.body:
Only replying one more time since we obviously fundamentally disagree, but feel like responding because you're still misinterpreting my points. 

ARAM will not make you worse at the game. Playing knockout will not make you a worse basketball player. Flag football will not make you worse at football. Home run derby's won't make you worse at baseball. ARAM is not going to make you worse at SR. It's straight up nonsensical.

I'm not going to suggest to anyone taking rank seriously to ARAM for training. But new players, and players who are literally iron 4 and therefore probably worse than the majority of fresh level 30s, I totally will. Because they very very very likely still struggle with basic mechanical functions of the game. And basic champion knowledge. 

And outside of treating the game like a school assignment, ARAM is one of the better outlets for getting as much champion interaction in as possible per minute spent, while also staying entertaining.
